I came across this hotel, in the middle of downtown Mexico City,
called Posada del Sol. "Hotel of the Sun"
and when it was was built a hundred years ago it was
supposed to one of the most beautiful
the entire country.
The owner was an architect, and he
sculpted every stone, he laid mosaics in
the floors and walls, and hired famous
artists to paint murals all over the hotel
However the hotel was only ever open for
eight months, and then it was closed.
They said that he had ties with the
Freemasons and there was some internal
problems. Also stories of a girl dying
in the basement, and no one ever knowing why.
After was abandoned
Negro Durazo, a very corrupt and very
famous police chief was said to have
tortured students in the basement.
I don't know how much that is true, but
we've been given access to the hotel today.
It's been abandoned for a very
long time and
I'm excited to show you.
But! I gotta stash the camera first
This says "F S G" which is the letters of the name of
the architect and owner of this place
Fernando Saldaña Galván. He made this in
1945 when the hotel was taken.
This is very important because this is like,
how do you say? ...A curse?
A curse? To the people that took the
hotel from him.
This says "Suum Cuique"
which means "what comes around goes around"
- So because this was taken from the
owner, he wrote this, he carved this in and he
basically put a curse on them because

they took this from him. 
- Exactly. You took
this for me, and something will be taken
from you someday. "Chik Chik Chik" just before left...
This place is so cool!
So the story goes that all the
musicians played in this area, and the
sound would go up into the hole in the
ceiling
this boards over now, but it would
reflect up into the people drinking and
dining on the floor above. Hopefully we
can check that out too.
- So did you see downstairs hole in the ceiling?

- Yeah I saw it.
- This is where the music would come out
up top.
People would be be chilling here like having a

drink and relaxing th-----
- Posada del Sol?
- Yeah, Posada del Sol
and then the music
would come up, bounce off the ceiling,
and everyone would just be able to chill here and enjoy
the music.

- Do you think we're missing anything cool?
- Nah, The theatre is this way.

- Do we know what's upstairs?
- *Whisper* Noooo, coooome onnnn
- *Whispers* Coooomeee Here. Followwww the liiiight.
Ladies and Gentlemen! Welcome to the theatre!

- It's a penis.
- One of them there penises

- One of them phallic objects
*Laughing*

*Background talking* 
- This is like a devil, and that's like the angel.

*Background talking*

- Alright! Here we are. This is the basement.
- Yeah we gotta go pay our dues and respects

- Jesus it's dark.

- No one knows her name.

- What is that stuff?

- So, there's a legend that says tha----

- Here to the right.
- It's here!

- Look at that! 
- The shrine for the girl!
The rumors say there was girl who died when the hotel was in
service and they found her body.
No one knows how she died, but they put her
dress and a photo of her in the basement and
now when you come here, you have to give her candy so she doesn't haunt you.

- Cody. No one likes melted chocolate bars... 
- I'm hoping she forgives me.
she's gonna haunt the shit out of you.
All these things are what people brought her
over the years
The story was that she lost her parents,
fell into the basement, and then they found her body?
- No, she died and no one could find her, and then they found her dead.
And they made this shrine

- And did she die in this dress?
- Yeah
Duuuuude...

- I've got one Lolly Pop.
- I hear she likes those.
There you go... Please let us escape here safely.
So! We are just finishing our day exploring Posada del Sol
This is a spot that i found
on this Spanish website, and i was
looking for another crazy haunted
mansion. This one came up and was like...
Oh my god... this is three blocks from where
i'm living in Mexico City. So we checked
it out. I hit up these guys, they came down
to Mexico City and we've lined up a
couple cool things the film that are all
abandoned but so happy we could make
this happen
- I mean this guy litterally calls me two or
three days ago. After I got back from Bali
he's like hey come
to Mexico, we got to sick hotel we're
doing. Doll island too. I was like okay I think I can make it

and I just flew down here.
- I was like I've got a spot that I think you guys will love.
- and we did love it!
- I think it was one of my favourite places we've ever been
- If not the top place.
